intro: Topobea ciliata, commonly known as the silky sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Topobea ciliata is an important species for pollinators and is often found in coastal dunes and desert scrub habitats.
